message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with visual data such as images and videos and proposes a graph-based encoding of label information for performing graph-based inference in label space for a number of tasks including multi-label image and video classification and action detection in untrimmed videos. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes the use of Bidirectional Inference Neural Network (BINN) and Structured Inference Neural Network (SINN) for performing graph-based inference, which suggests that the paper could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also evaluates its methods on large-scale datasets such as YouTube-8M and THUMOS'14, which suggests that it could belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) and Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-categories.
